item.title: Cyber Security Is a Game of Chess: Strategy, Anticipation, and the Battle of Wits
item.description: When the NotPetya cyberattack struck in 2017, it spread across networks with the precision of a grandmaster executing a flawless chess strategy. Organizations worldwide were caught off-guard, leading to billions in damages. This watershed moment in cybersecurity history demonstrates how cyber security is much like a high-stakes game of chessâ€”professionals must anticipate their opponent’s moves, develop robust strategies, and sometimes make sacrifices to protect their most valuable assets. The parallels between cyber security and chess are profound, offering valuable insights into how organizations can better defend themselves in an ever-evolving digital landscape.
